meanings.definition: Deprived of sacred character or purpose.
meanings.sent1: The old church was deconsecrated and turned into a community center.
meanings.sent2: The deconsecrated altar stood empty and forgotten.
meanings.sent3: The deconsecrated cemetery became a peaceful park for families to enjoy.
meanings.sent4: Her deconsecrated necklace held sentimental value despite losing its religious significance.
meanings.sent5: The deconsecrated temple was now just a shell of its former glory.

meanings.sent1: The priest deconsecrated the holy water before disposing of it.
meanings.sent2: They had to deconsecrate the church after it was no longer in use.
meanings.sent3: The magician jokingly deconsecrated the top hat before pulling out a rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The artist deconsecrated the canvas by painting over the original masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The ritual to deconsecrate the ancient artifact was performed under the full moon.
